form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Tuesday, the sixth day of January, two thousand and fifteen
form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To extend the authorization to carry out the replacement of the existing medical center of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Denver, Colorado, to authorize transfers of amounts to carry out the replacement of such medical center, and for other purposes.

section.header: Extension of authorization for Department of Veterans Affairs major medical facility project previously authorized
section.text: Section 2(a) of the Construction Authorization and Choice Improvement Act (Public Law 114–19) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking in fiscal year 2015,; and

section.header: Limited, one-time authority to transfer specific amounts to carry out major medical facility project in Denver, Colorado

subsection.text: Of the unobligated balances of amounts available to the Department of Veterans Affairs for fiscal year 2015, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs may transfer amounts from the appropriations accounts under the following headings, in the amounts and from the activities specified, to the appropriations account under the heading Construction, Major Projects:

paragraph.text: Medical Services, $6,494,000 to be derived from amounts available for the Human Capital Investment Plan.
Medical Support and Compliance, $1,611,000 to be derived from amounts available for the Human Capital Investment Plan.
Medical Facilities, $80,735,000 to be derived from amounts available for green energy projects of the Department and human capital investment plans.
National Cemetery Administration, $60,000 to be derived from amounts available for the Human Capital Investment Plan.
General Administration, $1,130,000 to be derived from amounts available for the Office of the Secretary.
General Operating Expenses, Veterans Benefits Administration, $670,000 to be derived from amounts available for the Human Capital Investment Plan.
Information Technology Systems, $240,000 to be derived from amounts available for the Human Capital Investment Plan.
Construction, Minor Projects, $3,000,000 to be derived from amounts available for minor construction projects at the staff offices of the Department.

subsection.header: Transfer of amounts available in funds

paragraph.text: Of the unobligated balances of amounts available in the revolving supply fund of the Department under section 8121 of title 38, United States Code, the Secretary may transfer $20,030,000 to the appropriations account under the heading Construction, Major Projects.

Of the unobligated balances of amounts available in the Department of Veterans Affairs Franchise Fund established in title I of the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 1997 (Public Law 104–204; 31 U.S.C. 501 note), the Secretary may transfer $36,030,000 to the appropriations account under the heading Construction, Major Projects.

subsection.text: The amounts transferred under subsections (a) and (b) shall—

paragraph.text: be used only to carry out the major medical facility construction project in Denver, Colorado, specified in section 2 of the Construction Authorization and Choice Improvement Act (Public Law 114–19); and

Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate
